name: oxlip
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a wild plant of the primula family with several small, pale yellow flowers growing together on a long stem: The ground was covered in primroses, oxlips, cowslips, and violets. Protesters claim that the oxlip is threatened by the airport expansion.
More examplesFewer examplesThe oxlip is a rare, shade-loving species with flowers that hang to one side at the top of a tall stem.Oxlips had disappeared from 28 of the 80 listed sites in less than 30 years.Oxlips seem to have been much more common in Shakespeare's time than they are now.
